skill.name: devops-runbooks
skill.description: Operational runbook and procedure documentation specialist. Use when creating incident response procedures, operational playbooks, or system maintenance guides.
skill.summary: Creates structured operational runbooks and incident response documentation for DevOps teams
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation templates for operational runbooks. All static findings are false positives - the detected patterns are placeholder text within markdown code blocks, not executable code. The skill contains no actual command execution, network access, or sensitive data handling. It is a pure documentation template for guiding users in creating their own runbooks.

content.user_title: Create Professional DevOps Runbooks and Incident Guides
content.value_statement: Operations teams need standardized runbooks for incident response and system maintenance. This skill generates structured runbook documentation with clear procedures, rollback steps, and escalation paths.
actual_capabilities: Generate structured operational runbooks with standard sections and formatting
Create incident response procedures with clear step-by-step instructions
Document rollback procedures and troubleshooting guides for system operations
Define escalation paths and contact information for operational teams
Provide templates for verification steps and success criteria
Structure knowledge transfer documentation for on-call teams
limitations: Does not execute commands or interact with systems directly
Requires user input to fill in environment-specific details and credentials
Cannot validate if documented procedures work in actual systems
Does not automatically update runbooks when systems change

use_cases.title: Incident Response Planning
use_cases.description: Create step-by-step incident response runbooks for on-call engineers handling production outages with clear verification steps and escalation procedures.

use_cases.title: System Maintenance Documentation
use_cases.description: Document routine maintenance procedures for database updates, deployment rollbacks, or infrastructure changes with rollback instructions.

use_cases.title: Knowledge Transfer for On-Call Teams
use_cases.description: Standardize operational knowledge into actionable runbooks for new team members joining on-call rotations or inheriting system ownership.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Database Backup Runbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a runbook for performing daily database backups on a PostgreSQL production server
prompt_templates.scenario: New team member needs to perform routine database maintenance

prompt_templates.title: Service Restart Procedure
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a runbook for restarting the payment processing service with zero downtime using blue-green deployment
prompt_templates.scenario: On-call engineer needs to restart a critical service safely

prompt_templates.title: Incident Response for High CPU
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an incident response runbook for when application servers reach 90% CPU utilization with investigation and mitigation steps
prompt_templates.scenario: Production alert fires during business hours

prompt_templates.title: Complete Disaster Recovery Runbook
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive disaster recovery runbook for restoring the entire production environment from backups including database, application servers, and configuration
prompt_templates.scenario: Major infrastructure failure requires full system restoration

output_examples.input: Create a runbook for restarting the web application
output_examples.output: A structured runbook document with overview, prerequisites, step-by-step restart procedure, verification commands, rollback steps, troubleshooting common errors, and escalation contacts organized into clear sections.

output_examples.input: Generate incident response procedure for database connection failures
output_examples.output: A comprehensive incident runbook including severity classification, quick reference commands for checking connections, detailed investigation steps, resolution procedures, and post-incident review checklist.
A rollback runbook with clear prerequisites, commands for reverting to previous version, verification steps to confirm rollback success, and troubleshooting section for rollback failures.

best_practices: Include expected output for each command to help operators verify success
Document rollback procedures immediately after each major step
Keep runbooks current by including last tested date and scheduling regular reviews
anti_patterns: Creating runbooks without testing the procedures in a staging environment first
Writing vague instructions like check the logs without specifying exact commands or log locations
Omitting escalation criteria and contact information for when procedures fail

faq.question: Does this skill execute the commands in the runbooks?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates documentation templates. It does not execute any commands or interact with systems. Users copy and adapt the procedures for their environments.

faq.question: Can I customize the runbook template structure?
faq.answer: Yes. The generated runbooks follow a standard structure but you can modify sections, add custom fields, or adapt the format to match your team standards.

faq.question: How do I keep runbooks updated as systems change?
faq.answer: Include a last updated date and testing schedule in each runbook. Regenerate or update runbooks after significant system changes and validate procedures in staging environments.

faq.question: What level of detail should runbook commands include?
faq.answer: Commands should be copy-pasteable and include expected output. Provide enough context for someone unfamiliar with the system to execute safely with minimal interpretation.

faq.question: How do I handle sensitive credentials in runbooks?
faq.answer: Reference credential locations like vault paths or secrets managers rather than including actual credentials. Document which systems and permissions are required in the prerequisites section.

faq.question: Can this skill create runbooks for any type of system?
faq.answer: Yes. The template structure works for databases, applications, cloud infrastructure, or any operational system. You provide system-specific commands and the skill organizes them into the runbook format.
